climbs.name: Unknown Hammerhead Roof Route (Rabbit Hole Project?)

content.description:
4 bolts to mussy hook anchors. Traverse right on rotten arete and exfoliating face. Poor feet and poor quality rock through three bolts until you're under the roof. Big pocket will lure you in until you realize it too isn't very positive. This is as far as I made it. Somehow lean back and clip a bolt under the roof and make a very big throw to a suspect lip. Mantle and you're home. I'd venture 11+ or 12. I'll gladly update this with FA information.

Is this the Rabbit Hole Project referred to on the Hammerhead route page?
content.location: On Hammerhead rock. Just right of Hammerhead (5.6).

content.description: This route was bolted ground-up with a hand drill. It may have been soloed in the past as it is not very hard and you can walk right up to it. Our apologies if we bolted your old line. On a positive note, now anyone can enjoy it! 5.6 move to a good stance, over and over, all the way to the top.
content.protection: Five stainless steel bolts to a two bolt, ring anchor. (not a typical "lower off" anchor)
content.location: This route is on the big right leaning boulder at the bottom of the pile, a little ways left of the other "Ghosts" formations. It doesn't require any scrambling to get to. It's right next to "The Rabbit Hole Project" if you know where that is. There is a nice little V-easy boulder 15 feet in front of it.
